Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Class DSNRecipientParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.DSNRecipientParameters
  • public class DSNRecipientParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    DSN recipient parameters from the RCPT TO command.

    This class holds the DSN-related parameters specified in the RCPT TO command as defined in RFC 3461:

    • NOTIFY - When to send DSN (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE, DELAY)
    • ORCPT - Original recipient address (for forwarding)

    Example RCPT TO with DSN parameters: 

     RCPT TO:<recipient@example.com> NOTIFY=SUCCESS,FAILURE ORCPT=rfc822;original@example.com

    The ORCPT address is transmitted as xtext (RFC 3461 Section 4) and is automatically decoded when parsed.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    DSNNotify, RFC 3461 - SMTP DSN

    • Constructor Detail

      • DSNRecipientParameters

        public DSNRecipientParameters​(java.util.Set<DSNNotify> notify,
                              java.lang.String orcptType,
                              java.lang.String orcptAddress)
        Creates new DSN recipient parameters.
        Parameters:
        notify - the set of notification conditions, may be null or empty
        orcptType - the original recipient address type (e.g., "rfc822"), may be null
        orcptAddress - the original recipient address, may be null

    • Method Detail

      • getNotify

        public java.util.Set<DSNNotify> getNotify()
        Returns the NOTIFY parameter values.

        This indicates when DSN messages should be generated for this recipient. If empty, the server uses its default behaviour.

        Returns:
        an unmodifiable set of notification conditions

      • isNotifyNever

        public boolean isNotifyNever()
        Returns true if NOTIFY=NEVER was specified.
        Returns:
        true if no DSN should ever be sent for this recipient

      • isNotifySuccess

        public boolean isNotifySuccess()
        Returns true if NOTIFY=SUCCESS was specified.
        Returns:
        true if DSN should be sent on successful delivery

      • isNotifyFailure

        public boolean isNotifyFailure()
        Returns true if NOTIFY=FAILURE was specified.
        Returns:
        true if DSN should be sent on delivery failure

      • isNotifyDelay

        public boolean isNotifyDelay()
        Returns true if NOTIFY=DELAY was specified.
        Returns:
        true if DSN should be sent on delivery delay

      • getOrcptType

        public java.lang.String getOrcptType()
        Returns the ORCPT address type.

        This is typically "rfc822" for standard email addresses.

        Returns:
        the address type, or null if not specified

      • getOrcptAddress

        public java.lang.String getOrcptAddress()
        Returns the ORCPT address.

        This is the original recipient address before any forwarding or aliasing. It can be used in DSN messages to indicate the address the sender originally used.

        Returns:
        the original recipient address, or null if not specified

      • hasOrcpt

        public boolean hasOrcpt()
        Returns true if an ORCPT was specified.
        Returns:
        true if original recipient information is available

      • hasParameters

        public boolean hasParameters()
        Returns true if any DSN parameters were specified.
        Returns:
        true if NOTIFY or ORCPT is set

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
